credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Design for ceiling decoration
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation of the scheme of -1534. The arch is decorated with one half of a plant. A mean is seated below, holding a compass. The panel in the center shows a trophy. The painting represents a scene of Roman history in a setting of ruins.
name: Drawing
